titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Cuyler B. and Cynthia E. Tuthill will 1980.018
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-03 16:46:58 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Cuyler B. and Cynthia E. Tuthill will
did.abstract: The last will and testament of Cuyler B. and Cynthia E. Tuthill of Floral Park, Long Island, dated 1925.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Cuyler B. and Cynthia E. Tuthill will, 1980.018, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Brooklyn Historical Society Genealogical vertical files (ARC.313) - folders: Tuthill; Ingersoll, Tuthill
Stuart Tuthill Terry notes on Southold genealogy (1973.184)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The last will and testament of Cuyler B. and Cynthia E. Tuthill of Floral Park, Long Island, dated 1925. The will was witnessed by Nelanor and Frank Schwartz, also of Floral Park, and prepared by attorney J. Gerard McLaughlin of Jamaica, Queens.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
